page.title: 10Hadstock Silver Band
page.content: The band was originally the Linton Band until they went to war and some of them didn't come back. So they made a band with the people from Hadstock, and the people from Linton wanted to join the Salvation Army, but the people from Hadstock didn't want to because in the Salvation Army you are not allowed to drink alcohol. Mrs.Pring said that there are about thirty people in the Silver Band and the age group is 8_60 years old. In a contest they came first in one thing and second in the hymn. The instruments include cornets, tubas and all sorts of horn. The band practises in the village hall about twice a week. Sometimes they come to Saffron Walden on the Saturday nearest to Christmas to play near the Building Society.
